file_content.text: Thank you again, Sith.
Sith. You made it back. I take it... I take it Nomar's dead, then.
His damn Jedi philosophy got the better of him.
He was a fool.
I'm sorry about that.
My apologies.
Don't be. In a way, I'm glad he's gone.
Death was a mercy once I was done with him.
He's lucky.
Please, I don't miss him, but I'm not sure I need such... detail.
I was foolish to think that he could ever care about anything other than that stupid Jedi Order.
To think I wasted twenty years on that man.
Now you can move on.
There's still time.
Yes, and thank you.
How could you know?
Don't beat yourself up.
No, I suppose you're right. Still.
He was cute when he was younger.
I don't blame you.
He didn't age well, did he? Well, anyway, I came to thank you.
If you'd taken a little better care of yourself....
It's your own fault.
You know, I came here to thank you, not to be insulted.
I think I might have wasted the rest of my life on that fool if you hadn't come along.
And now one of King Ulgo's brothers has asked for my hand, and I've said yes.
So much for true love.
That was fast.
Now you can finally move on.
Good for you!
Well, it's hardly what you'd call an arrangement of the heart.
But Ulgo is well-positioned, and an ally of House Rist.
So, I may have children and raise a family, yet.
I hope it makes you happy.
If that's what you want.
I think so.
It sounds like the smart choice.
You're doing the right thing.
Do you really think so? I have my doubts, honestly.
Think of it. All those little assassin children....
Aw, how sweet.
You must think me rash.
But I wanted to give you this. It's a small token, but it has some value.
I was holding onto it as a reminder of Nomar--but, well... take it as my thanks.
Why are you telling me this?
I really don't care.
No, I suppose you wouldn't care. Sith and Jedi are alike in that respect--selfish and cruel.
Goodbye, Sith. I hope you find a better end than Nomar.
Meet me in the caves at the far end of the Killik tunnels.
Go, do what you will with Nomar, but you'll get no more help from me.
Let me bring him up.
Rehanna. What--what a surprise.
I know it must be. Nomar, there's something I need to talk to you about.
Go ahead. Anything I can do. Anything at all.
Not--not like this. It's a favor I need, here on Alderaan. I was hoping we could meet.
Of course. I can be there in a few hours. The old place?
Yes, the old place. Thank you.
There. Are you happy now?
Where's Nomar going to be?
What's the meeting place?
Tell me about this meeting place!
Where will he be? [Shock]
Aaarrrgh!
I'll give you the coordinates, but I won't come with you. And you'd better get out of here.
The meeting spot is in an underground cave near House Cortess. But the entrance tunnels are filled with Killiks, so good luck.
What exactly are Killiks?
Killiks?
Bug men. And I hope they tear you to pieces!
What kind of secret meeting place is that?
Yuck.
There were no Killiks there twenty years ago. But you know what--I hope they tear you to pieces.
You're trying to get me killed, is that it?
You can't fool me. [Shock.]
Aaaarrrgh!
I can't say I'd miss you, Sith.
Now get out of my house!
I'll be happy when you're dead.
In a minute. [Kill her]
Do you really think he'll come?
I'm sure he will.
Yes.
I'll be with you.
Don't worry.
I can't believe I'm doing this.
Anyway, he's agreed to meet me in our old hiding spot in one of Alderaan's underground tunnels. Here are the coordinates.
Unfortunately, the native sentient insect species, the Killiks, have moved into the tunnels lately. I'll have to meet you there.
Did you say native sentient insect species?
Bugs?
Yes. They haven't moved all the way into the old place, but they've penetrated pretty deep.
Just don't get cold feet.
You better show.
Ah, bugs! My favorite!
Bugs!
Um, yes. At least you aren't squeamish.
I'll be using the shadows as cover, but you and that monster of yours will probably draw a lot of attention to yourselves.
I'll be using the shadows as cover, but you and that surly fellow will probably have to fight.
I'll be using the shadows as cover, but the territory is unfamiliar to you. You'll likely have a fight on your hands.
I'll meet you down there shortly.
I'm just going to kill him.
Do you think I care?
What? No... you--you vile, cruel person.
I won't let you. You won't lay a hand on him!
Aaaarrrgh!
All right. You win, I'll call him. Nomar Organa's not worth dying for.
But then I want you out of my home.
Call Nomar Organa and I'll go.
All right.
I knew you'd see it my way.
Finally.
Don't be too smug. Coercion can hardly be equated with persuasion.
You're hardly in a position to make demands.
Not your call.
No, I suppose not.
Congratulations, Sith. You've broken into my home, butchered my assassins and forced your way into my personal chambers.
Can I at least offer you a drink before you start making demands?
Let's skip the drink and you can tell me about this holo.
No thank you.
A drink would be nice.
Certainly.
Excellent. People have so little time for hospitality these days.
So tell me, what does the bright-eyed young daughter of Thul want from Rehanna Rist?
The only thing I will drink is your blood.
This isn't a social call.
I'm afraid my blood is not on offer. Not without a fight at any rate.
So tell me then, what does Elana Thul want?
I don't know about her, but I want to discuss Nomar Organa.
This isn't about Lady Thul.
I believe this has your name on it.
Here. [Give holo]
We were curious about the contents of this holo.
We had a few questions.
Well, well. Let me guess. You dug this holo out of some dusty archive in House Alde.
Let's just say that his royal Jedi-ness Nomar Organa and I are ancient history, and leave that dead dog buried.
Let's not do that.
No.
There must have been some good times....
But you did love him once.
I don't know what you expect me to say.
Nomar Organa and I were in love. I'm sure he'd write it off as misguided youthfulness--but it's true.
We were going to get married, in spite of our families' disapproval, and then he got cold feet. That's all.
He seemed really hurt when you stormed out.
I doubt it.
Hurt? No. Righteous maybe. Full of himself.
Why have you never married?
Why are you still single?
Ha. You think I'm pining for Nomar Organa, is that it?
Isn't that the reason?
Makes sense.
That's the rumor around Alderaan.
So I've heard.
Hmph. Alderaan and its web of rumors. Do yourself a favor and don't get caught in it, Sith. You'll never get out.
Anyway, what does it matter if I still love him? He certainly doesn't care one wit about me.
Have you asked?
How do you know?
He made his position quite clear, I think.
No, why should I even torture myself with the thought?
Call. Ask him to meet you, and if he agrees....
Something good could happen.
And if he agrees... no! I can't believe I'm even entertaining this ludicrous notion.
Still, it would be nice to see him again. But what would I say? What would I do?
Ask him to keep his promise to marry you.
Tell him what you want.
You'll know what to say.
Don't worry.
Just call him dammit.
I'm losing patience.
No, no, this is--this is just....
What should I say? "Hello, I know we haven't talked in over twenty years, but will you please marry me?" I won't.
I'm not leaving until you call.
Did I not make myself clear?
So that's it, then. You won't take "no" for an answer.
That's the wrong answer.
Try again. [Shock]
It seems you've sealed your fate and his.
Then you will both die.
I'll show you torture.
Call him, dammit! [Shock]
Either you bring him here or I kill you.
Don't make this hard.
He cares more than you think.
He said he was sorry.
I--I don't know. It's been so long. Twenty-three years.
Fine, I'll--I'll call him, and ask him to meet me here. But I'm going with you--for my own safety. I don't quite trust you.
I'm only worried about your happiness.
Don't worry.
I won't harm you or Nomar.
I promise you'll both be okay.
I'm losing patience.
Bring me Nomar Organa or die.
Let's cut to the chase.
Bring Nomar to me or die.
Let's make this simple.
Then you won't mind calling him up so I can kill him.
If you're so over him....
What? No. I couldn't. I don't know what you think I am!
I thought you were an assassin.
Why the qualms?
What does that have to do with anything?
So you still have feelings for him.
I see.
Having "feelings" for someone and not wanting them dead are very different things, Sith.
If you expect to get any information out of me so that you can kill Nomar, you're mistaken.
Do it right now!
Call him! [Shock]
Aaaaarrrgh! You... sick... monster!
Tell me about Nomar Organa or die.
I'm not giving you a choice.
You think because you are Sith you can intimidate me with threats?
I've seen more of war than either you or that little bird Thul, and you won't get anything out of me without a fight.
Thank you, thank you. I'm bringing him up right now.
Right, right. I'm bringing him up right now.
Fine, I'll--I'll call him, and ask him to meet me here. But you must promise not to hurt him.
As long as he does not provoke me.
I will not start anything.
I promise.
I can't vouch for all my personalities.
I'll try.
